body_content.explanation: one of the joints in the body on each side of the head that connect the mandible (= the bone that forms the shape of the lower part of the face) to the temporal bones, which are at the sides of the skull (= the bones of the head that surround the brain and give the upper part of the head its shape):
examples: When you open or close your mouth, the bones that are moving are your temporomandibular joints.
Many people experience clicking or popping in the temporomandibular joint.
